meanings.sent1: I accidentally flyblow the fruit by leaving it uncovered.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to flyblow the food by keeping it sealed.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a disaster when the flies decided to flyblow everything!
meanings.sent4: The gossip spread through the town, like flies flyblowing a fresh apple.
meanings.sent5: The dirty kitchen was a perfect place for flies to flyblow and ruin the food.

meanings.sent1: The boxer delivered a powerful flyblow to his opponent.
meanings.sent2: He felt the flyblow on his shoulder after the fall.
meanings.sent3: The playful snowball fight ended with a surprising flyblow to the face.
meanings.sent4: The sudden realization hit her like a unexpected flyblow.
meanings.sent5: The tree branch gave a sharp flyblow to the window during the storm.

meanings.sent1: She noticed a tiny flyblow on the otherwise clean mirror.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully removed every flyblow from the painting.
meanings.sent3: The perfectly white wall was ruined by a single flyblow of paint.
meanings.sent4: The night sky was filled with stars, each one a tiny flyblow of light.
meanings.sent5: The pristine snow was marred by a single flyblow of dirt.
